frameDefinitions: A Mother and Father produce a Child or an Egg. 'Betty bore Gerry three intelligent daughters.'
This frame concerns entities conventionally being referred to by particular names.
A Speaker uses a particular linguistic form, a Name to refer to an Entity.
A stretch of linguistic discourse or a Text that a Communicator produces has a Topic that it is about.
A Speaker addresses an Audience on a particular Topic.
Words in this frame describe a relationship in which an Item is expressed through a Text.
frameExamples: They corresponded frequently and at length, exchanging intimate letters in which he <t>addressed</t> her as Windflower.
McNamara <t>addressed</t> congress on the state of affairs of the Department of Defense.
The act of murder is rampant <t>in</t> the Bible.
listRoleDefinitions: <fen>Mother</fen> is the female creature that produces the <fen>Child</fen>.
<fen>Child</fen> identifies the new self-motile creature produced from the <fen>Mother</fen> and <fen>Father</fen>.
<fen>Father</fen> is the male creature that copulates with the <fen>Mother</fen>, thus  leading to the birth of the <fen>Child</fen>.
<fen>Egg</fen> is an immobile object containing an organism that may hatch as a mobile, infant organism.
The <fen>Mother</fen> and <fen>Father</fen> expressed together.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the event occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the event occurs.
<fen>Name</fen> identifies the linguistic expression used to refer to Entities.
The <fen>Entity</fen> is the person the speaker intends to refer to by using a particular name.
The person who uses the <fen>Name</fen>  to refer to the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The entity that is designated by the <fen>Speaker</fen> with the <fen>Name</fen> used.
The linguistic form used by the <fen>Speaker</fen> to refer to the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The point of time or interval when the <fen>Speaker</fen> uses the <fen>Name</fen>.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is what a <fen>Text</fen> is about.
A set of propositions that is coherent in being about a <fen>Topic</fen>
The <fen>Communicator</fen> is the person who has produced a <fen>Text</fen> on a <fen>Topic</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Communicator</fen> produces <fen>Text</fen> on a <fen>Topic</fen>.
The person or persons to whom the <fen>Speaker</fen> delivers their text.
The person who orally delivers a text about a <fen>Topic</fen> to a passive <fen>Audience</fen>.
What the text that the <fen>Speaker</fen> produces is about.
The <fen>Time</fen> describes when the speaking occurs.
The <fen>Place</fen> describes the location where the speaking occurs.
The written source, body of work, or linguistic utterance in which the <fen>Item</fen> is found/expressed.
The piece of information or expression that is contained within the <fen>Text</fen>.
When the <fen>Item</fen> appears in the <fen>Text</fen>.
listRoleExamples: Female clownfish lay <fex>their eggs</fex> around sea anemones
<fex>We</fex> are going to be having twins!
<fex>The Lord, who was charmed by her beauty,</fex> addressed her as 'than kaadhali!' (My darling) and hence the name.
And that's the reason why we called <fex>him</fex> 'Tom' when his real name was actually John.
A male voice answered the call, and Jones addressed the man as <fex>'Johnny.'</fex>
No one had <fex>ever</fex> called her 'my lady'.
In his book, <fex>Smithers</fex> discusses cotton production.
He lectured <fex>to the officers of the Scots Guard</fex>  in  1929.
<fex>You</fex> have to sermonize about the good times
He was the Director: he could lecture <fex>on whomever he liked</fex>.
